definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to ascertain/to act on/to criticize/to pass on/classifier for batches, lots, military flights/tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)

sentences.english: The interviewer spends a lot of time answering your questions.
sentences.chinese: 面試官花大批時間答覆你的問題。

sentences.english: During this period, a large number of youngers participated in the movement and went abroad.
sentences.chinese: 在這期間大批青年遠涉重洋，赴法留學。

sentences.english: An army of doctors blitzed the disease .
sentences.chinese: 一大批醫生對這種疾病發起猛攻。

sentences.english: It was the first high-volume mass -produced model.
sentences.chinese: 它是第一款大批量生產的車型。

sentences.english: They are now mass-producing this kind of instrument.
sentences.chinese: 他們現在正在大批生產這種儀器。

sentences.english: Low-alcohol Lujiu (liquors produced in Shandong) is the first to enter national market in quantities.
sentences.chinese: 低度魯酒率先大批量地走向全國市場。

sentences.english: The police found an arsenal of knives and guns in the terrorists' hideout.
sentences.chinese: 警方在恐怖分子的藏身地發現大批刀槍。

sentences.english: But then have a large number of the soldiers of qing appear, iron young tiger immediately call all fled.
sentences.chinese: 但隨即已有大批清兵出現，鐵彪立刻叫衆人躲避。

sentences.english: But in the wake of the Fannie Mae scandal, Raines still had legions of supporters.
sentences.chinese: 但在房利美醜聞後，雷恩斯仍有一大批支持者。

sentences.english: Hand hooping with a hula hoop is fun because of the large number of possibilities for variety in tricks.
sentences.chinese: 手用呼拉圈套箍，是因爲各種可能性大批過關樂趣。

sentences.english: She expected a shortage of dried fruit so she laid in a large supply.
sentences.chinese: 她預期果脯會有短缺，所以囤積了一大批。

sentences.english: A great number of the Nationalist Party leaders came from Guangdong Province, the cradle of the party.
sentences.chinese: 國民黨發跡於廣東，也造就了大批粵籍黨國領袖。

sentences.english: Attracted a large number of the second district of Jiaxing five backbone teachers to join.
sentences.chinese: 吸引了大批嘉興五縣二區幼兒園骨幹教師的加盟。

sentences.english: It also has a “whole lot of planes” to keep in the air, as she puts it.
sentences.chinese: 她指出，亞航也保有“一大批的飛機”在運營中。

sentences.english: It occurs for a large number of reasons, which can be categorised into conductive and sensorineural.
sentences.chinese: 出現了一大批的原因，可分爲傳導性和感音神經性。

definition: (used for abstract things) a good deal, a lot of
to fall over each other in their eagerness to...
in turn/successively/one after the other/bit by bit
lit. by the thousands and tens of thousands (idiom); untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
lit. their number cannot be counted (idiom); fig. countless/innumerable
to gather (in a crowd)/to converge/to swarm
to emerge in large numbers/to spring up/to emerge prominently
